chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M. Wierzba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with 18 years old or under.  No contact with victim.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling.  

Defendant must register as sex offender for period of 15 years.

1 year MCJ jail as condition of that probation.

15CF1062 -

$10,000.00 signature bond with first $2,500.00 in cash.    No contact with victim(s): V.S.B., nor cause anyone else to have contact with V.S.B. and no contact with any females under the age of 18 unless supervised by someone 25 years of age or older. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
